⊢ ∃(s0 ∈ ℕ,(s0[≤](cdc(1, 0)[^]cdc(2, 7))∧ ∀(s1 ∈ Odd,(s0[<]s1 → s1 ∈ GoldbachOdd))))

⊣ GoldbachOdd = { hs0 ∈ Odd | ∃(hs3 ∈ Prime, ∃(hs2 ∈ Prime, ∃(hs1 ∈ Prime,((hs3 ∈ Odd ∧ hs2 ∈ Odd ∧ hs1 ∈ Odd)∧ hs0 =((hs3[+]hs2)[+]hs1)))))}

-| diffss(s0, s1)

comment: Variant of Thierry Arnoux's ~ tgoldbachgt using the symbols ` Odd ` and ` GoldbachOdd ` : The ternary Goldbach conjecture is valid for large odd numbers (i.e. for all odd numbers greater than a fixed ` m ` ). This is proven by Helfgott (see section 7.4 in [Helfgott] p. 70) for ` m ` = 10^27. (Contributed by AV, 2-Aug-2020.) (Revised by AV, 15-Jan-2022.)
